decoworld.editor.gui

Class MapModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • decoworld.editor.gui.MapModel

  • public class MapModel
extends java.lang.Object
    The model for the Map. This manages the Map itself, and the renderer's TileActors.
    Invariant:
    m_TileActors[y][x] != null forall (x, y)

    • Constructor Summary

      Construct a new MapModel instance.
      MapModel(java.io.File file, EditorModel em)

      • MapModel

        public MapModel(java.io.File file,
        EditorModel em)
         throws java.io.IOException,
                java.text.ParseException
        Create a new map model.
        Parameters:
        file - The map file to load. null for an empty map. May not be null.
        em - The EditorModel managing the TileSets
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an error occurred loading the map.
        java.text.ParseException

      • getTile

        public decoworld.model.world.map.Tile getTile(int x,
                                     int y)
        Get the tile at x, y.
        Parameters:
        x - The 0-based X-coordinate of the tile.
        y - The 0-based Y-coordinate of the tile.
        Returns:
        The tile if x and y are valid. null if they are out of range.

      • setTile

        public void setTile(int x,
           int y,
           decoworld.model.world.map.Tile tile)
        Set the tile at position (x, y). This will set the modified flag if tile.getID() != m_Map.getTile(x, y).getID()
        Parameters:
        x - The 0-based X-coordinate of the tile.
        y - The 0-based Y-coordinate of the tile.
        tile - The tile.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If (x >= m_Map.getWidth()) || (y >= m_Map.getHeight()) || (tile == null)
